net.ligreto.data
Class SqlExecutionThread

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      net.ligreto.data.SqlExecutionThread
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class SqlExecutionThread
extends java.lang.Thread

The class allowing to execute the SQL statement in the separate execution thread. This allows the parallel execution of multiple queries on various data sources. The instances of this class should be used as follows: 

 SqlExecutionThread t1 = SqlExecutionThread.executeQuery(...);
 SqlExecutionThread t2 = SqlExecutionThread.executeQuery(...);
 try {
     t1.join();
     t2.join();
 } catch (InterruptedException e) {
     throw new LigretoException("Execution interrupted.", e);
 }
 t1.throwExceptions();
 t2.throwExceptions();

Author:
Julius Stroffek

Constructor Detail

SqlExecutionThread

Method Detail

executeQuery

public static SqlExecutionThread executeQuery(java.lang.String dataSource,
                                              java.lang.String query,
                                              SqlNode.QueryType queryType)
Executes the specified query in the separate execution thread. The created thread is started and returned as return value.

Parameters:
dataSource - the data source name where the query should be executed
query - the query string to be executed
queryType - the type of the query
Returns:
the created SqlExecutionThread object

run

public void run()
Execute the query. This method is called by Thread.start().

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

getThrowable

public java.lang.Throwable getThrowable()
Provides the access to the throwable object that was thrown during the thread execution.

Returns:
the throwable caught during the thread execution.

getResultSet

public java.sql.ResultSet getResultSet()
Provides the access to the result set.

Returns:
the result set returned by the query execution.

cleanup

public void cleanup()
             throws java.sql.SQLException,
                    LigretoException
Final cleanup. It will close result set, statement, connection.

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if database related problems occurred
LigretoException - if the query type is unknown

throwExceptions

public void throwExceptions()
                     throws LigretoException
This method will throw the exception in the current thread that was caught during the query execution.

Throws:
LigretoException - if the throwable object was caught during the query execution
